author: bgelens
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6?view=powershell-6).

-->

# Steps to reproduce

Add a #requires version statement with 6.2 to a script and run on 7.0.0-preview.1

```powershell
#requires -version 6.2
```

# Expected behavior

works

# Actual behavior

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10071039/59742639-7d6f1300-926e-11e9-831f-0cc4f0b548a2.png)

# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0-preview.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.0-preview.1
OS                             Darwin 18.6.0 Darwin Kernel Version 18.6.0: Thu Apr 25 23:16:27 PDT 2019; root:xnu-4903.…
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: kvprasoon
comments.body: Interesting, works only till 6.0, fails for 6.1/2.

comments.author: bgelens
comments.body: After some digging I found this issue [here](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/src/System.Management.Automation/engine/Utils.cs#L653) I'll see if I can fix it myself

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body:
:tada:This issue was addressed in #9943, which has now been successfully released as `v7.0.0-preview.3`.:tada:

Handy links:
* [Release Notes](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/tag/v7.0.0-preview.3)

title: #requires -version 6.2 throws on 7.0.0-preview.1
